alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY, NORTHWESTERN DEARBORN AND WESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Brookville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Oxford, Batesville, Brookville, Ross, Darrtown, Reily, Sunman, Millville, St. Leon, Scipio, Somerville, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Collinsville, Penntown, Rockdale, Mcgonigle, Sharptown and Saint Peter. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 152 and 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
